MINUTE ORDER: The Court ORDERS that: (1) Defendants shall file their Opposition to Plaintiff's 5 Motion for a Preliminary Injunction by April 4, 2025; (2) Plaintiff shall file its Reply by April 11, 2025; and 3) The parties shall appear for a hearing on the Motion via Zoom on April 25, 2025, at 3:00 p.m. So ORDERED by Chief Judge James E. Boasberg on March 25, 2025.

In October 2023, Plaintiff Erie County, New York, applied for a grant from Defendant Corporation for National and Community Service... In January 2024, Americorps approved the grant... On January 20, 2025, the President signed Executive Order 14151... On February 14, 2025, Americorps sent Erie County a letter... Erie County brings this action seeking injunctive and declaratory relief

extracted.value: Erie County applied for RSVP grant in 2023, approved in 2024; Americorps demanded DEI certification under new executive orders leading to lawsuit seeking injunctive/declaratory relief

Plaintiff Erie County New York hereby dismisses this case without prejudice, pursuant to Rule 41, because Defendant has changed its certification requirements since the filing of this suit. The motion for a preliminary injunction filed on March 21, 2025 (ECF No. 5), is accordingly withdrawn.
